Package org.cougaar.mts.rmi

This package contains the RMI and RMI-SSL link protocols.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
MT The RMI remote interface for inter-Node message passing.
RMISocketControlService This is an MTS-internal service used for simple socket manipulation in RMI communication.
SerializedMT Extension of the standard RMI interface that uses preserialized byte arrays instead of AttributedMessages.
SocketManagementListener API for getting callbacks when an incoming RMI connection opens and closes
SocketManagementService API for adding and removing SocketManagementListeners
 

Class Summary
EnableRmiSenderSideAspect Sample Aspect that will disable all of RMI for 30 seconds (by default) after a failure.
ManagedServerSocket A wrapper for ServerSocket.
MTImpl RMI remote object providing the implementation of MT.
RmiAccessControlPlugin Servlet that blocks RMI sockets from being created to Blacklist Hosts
RMILinkProtocol This LinkProtocol handles message passing via RMI, one example of RPC communication.
RMIRemoteObjectDecoder Decode an RMI RemoteObject from a URI.
RMIRemoteObjectEncoder Encode an RMI RemoteObject as a URI.
RMISocketControlAspect This Aspect creates a ServiceProvider for and implementation of the RMISocketControlService.
RMITestAspect This test Aspect uses the RMISocketControlService to set socket timeouts.
SerializedMTImpl Implementation of the SerializedMT rmi interface.
SerializedRMILinkProtocol This LinkProtocol is a simple extension of RMILinkProtocol that uses preserialization to send byte-arrays via the SerializedMT interface rather than AttributedMessages via the MT interface.
SSLRMILinkProtocol This LinkProtocol supports rmi over ssl.
 

Package org.cougaar.mts.rmi Description

This package contains the RMI and RMI-SSL link protocols. The RMI link protocol is used by default for inter-node communication and are mature and highly tested. This page is under construction. We hope to simplify the configuration of RMI advanced features

Configuration

To add features beyond the basic LAN and WAN templates, MTS Aspects must be added to the configuration file for each node.

Configuring SSL

SSL can be used to encrypt the RMI connections.

Enable SSL socket factory 

 -Dorg.cougaar.message.transport.server_socket_class=org.cougaar.mts.rmi.ManagedServerSocket

Add SSL link protocol 

 <component class="org.cougaar.mts.rmi.SSLRMILinkProtocol"
    insertionpoint="Node.AgentManager.Agent.MessageTransport.Component">
    
 <component class="org.cougaar.mts.base.LoopbackLinkProtocol"
    insertionpoint="Node.AgentManager.Agent.MessageTransport.Component">

Configuring Fail-over

RMI is not appropriate for some WAN and Firewalled environments. In these environments, you may want use RMI for inter-node communications among Nodes on the same LAN, but a different link protocol to access remote Nodes.

To enable the RMI link protocol all the following XML to all Nodes in a Runtime Configuration <component class='org.cougaar.mts.rmi.EnableRmiSenderSideAspect' insertionpoint="Node.AgentManager.Agent.MessageTransport.Component"> <component class='org.cougaar.mts.rmi.RMISocketControlAspect' insertionpoint="Node.AgentManager.Agent.MessageTransport.Component"> <component class='org.cougaar.mts.rmi.RMITestAspect' insertionpoint="Node.AgentManager.Agent.MessageTransport.Component"> <component class="org.cougaar.mts.rmi.RMILinkProtocol" insertionpoint="Node.AgentManager.Agent.MessageTransport.Component"> <component class="org.cougaar.mts.base.LoopbackLinkProtocol" insertionpoint="Node.AgentManager.Agent.MessageTransport.Component"> <component class="org.cougaar.mts.rmi.RmiAccessControlPlugin">

Configuring Network Address Translation (NAT)
